texts.label: text
texts.orig: It's no secret that I'm a fan of  Twitter  and  OpenStack . I found myself needing a better way to follow the rapid pace of OpenStack development and I figured that a Twitter bot would be a pretty good method for staying up to date.
texts.text: It's no secret that I'm a fan of  Twitter  and  OpenStack . I found myself needing a better way to follow the rapid pace of OpenStack development and I figured that a Twitter bot would be a pretty good method for staying up to date.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: I'd like to invite you to check out  @openstackwatch .
texts.text: I'd like to invite you to check out  @openstackwatch .

texts.label: text
texts.orig: First things first, it's a completely unofficial project that I worked on during my spare time and it's not affiliated with OpenStack in any way. If it breaks, it's most likely my fault.
texts.text: First things first, it's a completely unofficial project that I worked on during my spare time and it's not affiliated with OpenStack in any way. If it breaks, it's most likely my fault.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The bot watches for ticket status changes in  OpenStack's Gerrit server  and makes a tweet about the change within a few minutes. Every tweet contains the commit's project, owner, status, and a brief summary of the change. In addition, you'll get a link directly to the review page on the Gerrit server. Here's an example:
texts.text: The bot watches for ticket status changes in  OpenStack's Gerrit server  and makes a tweet about the change within a few minutes. Every tweet contains the commit's project, owner, status, and a brief summary of the change. In addition, you'll get a link directly to the review page on the Gerrit server. Here's an example:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: If you're not a fan of Twitter, there's a link to the RSS feed in the bio section, or you can just add this URL to your RSS feed reader:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: If you can come up with any ideas for improvements, please  let me know !
texts.text: If you can come up with any ideas for improvements, please  let me know !
